title: 110_hr746
content:
The "Safe and Orderly Withdrawal From Iraq Act" includes provisions for the withdrawal of US Armed Forces and defense contractors from Iraq, transfer of military facilities, prohibition on further deployment of US forces to Iraq, assistance to Iraqi Security Forces, social and economic reconstruction activities, asylum for Iraqi citizens, and a definition section. The "Safe and Orderly Withdrawal From Iraq Act" mandates the withdrawal of US Armed Forces and defense contractors from Iraq within 180 days. It prohibits increasing troop levels in Iraq without Congressional authorization and specifies redeployment locations outside of Iraq. The "Safe and Orderly Withdrawal From Iraq Act" mandates the withdrawal of US Armed Forces and defense contractors from Iraq within 180 days. Exceptions include retaining personnel for security at US diplomatic missions and reconstruction activities at the request of the Government of Iraq. Funds are made available for the safe withdrawal process. The Secretary of Defense can use available funds for the withdrawal of Armed Forces and defense contractors from Iraq as mandated by the "Safe and Orderly Withdrawal From Iraq Act." The "Transfer of United States Military Facilities in Iraq" section mandates the transfer of all US military facilities in Iraq to the Iraqi government. The "Prohibition on Use of Funds to Further Deploy United States Armed Forces to Iraq" section prohibits the deployment of US Armed Forces to Iraq after withdrawal. The "Assistance to Iraqi Security Forces and Multinational Forces in Iraq" section allows for financial assistance or equipment to be provided to Iraqi Security Forces or multinational forces in Iraq. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC RECONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES IN IRAQ.

This Act allows funds for social and economic reconstruction activities in Iraq at the request of the Iraqi Government.

SEC. 7. ASYLUM OR OTHER MEANS OF PROTECTION FOR IRAQI CITIZENS.

The President can arrange asylum or protection for Iraqi citizens endangered by the withdrawal of US Armed Forces from Iraq.

SEC. 8. DEFINITION.

The term "Armed Forces" in this Act refers to the definition in title 10, United States Code.
